sections.heading: Causative Formation
sections.content:
Causative verbs (使役形 - shieki-kei) express making or letting someone do something. The formation follows regular patterns based on verb groups.

Basic meaning: "Make someone do" "Let someone do" Formation adds: せる/させる Context determines "make" vs "let"

children.heading: Drop る, add させる
children.content: 食べる → 食べさせる "eat" → "make/let eat" 見る → 見させる "watch" → "make/let watch" 寝る → 寝させる "sleep" → "make/let sleep" 起きる → 起きさせる "wake up" → "make/let wake up" 教える → 教えさせる "teach" → "make/let teach" Simple pattern Drop final る Add させる

children.heading: Change to あ-stem, add せる
children.content: 書く → 書かせる (kaku → kakaseru) "write" → "make/let write" 読む → 読ませる (yomu → yomaseru) "read" → "make/let read" 話す → 話させる (hanasu → hanasaseru) "speak" → "make/let speak" 待つ → 待たせる (matsu → mataseru) "wait" → "make/let wait" 行く → 行かせる (iku → ikaseru) "go" → "make/let go" 飲む → 飲ませる (nomu → nomaseru) "drink" → "make/let drink" 泳ぐ → 泳がせる (oyogu → oyogaseru) "swim" → "make/let swim" Change to あ-form Add せる

children.heading: Special forms
children.content: する → させる "do" → "make/let do" 勉強する → 勉強させる "study" → "make/let study" 来る → 来させる (こさせる) "come" → "make/let come" Only two irregular Learn these separately

children.heading: Causative = る-verb
children.content: All causatives conjugate as る-verbs: 食べさせる (ru-verb pattern): Present: 食べさせる Past: 食べさせた Negative: 食べさせない Te-form: 食べさせて 行かせる (also ru-verb): Present: 行かせる Past: 行かせた Negative: 行かせない Te-form: 行かせて Regardless of original verb type All causatives become ru-verbs Consistent conjugation

children.heading: All patterns
children.content: る-verbs: 食べる → 食べさせる 見る → 見させる う-verbs: 書く → 書かせる 読む → 読ませる 話す → 話させる 待つ → 待たせる 死ぬ → 死なせる 遊ぶ → 遊ばせる 飲む → 飲ませる 帰る → 帰らせる 泳ぐ → 泳がせる 買う → 買わせる Irregular: する → させる 来る → 来させる Memorize patterns Practice formation

children.heading: Errors to avoid
children.content: ❌ Wrong stem ✗ 食べるさせる (keeping る) ✓ Correct ✓ 食べさせる ❌ Wrong ending for う-verbs ✗ 書きせる ✓ Correct あ-stem ✓ 書かせる ❌ Irregular confusion ✗ するさせる ✓ Correct irregular ✓ させる Practice prevents errors Know your verb groups

children.heading: Spotting causatives
children.content: If you see: 〜させる ending 〜せる ending Likely causative form Check verb stem Identify meaning 食べさせる → causative of 食べる 行かせる → causative of 行く

children.heading: Context determines
children.content: Same form, different meanings: 子供を遊ばせる "Make child play" (permission) OR "Let child play" (permission) 親が子供を勉強させる "Parent makes child study" (force) Context shows which Both use same form Natural interpretation

children.heading: させる vs させられる
children.content: させる = causative "make/let someone do" させられる = causative-passive "be made to do" 食べさせる "make (someone) eat" 食べさせられる "be made to eat" Different meanings Don't confuse Extra られる = passive

children.heading: Transitive vs intransitive
children.content: Intransitive base: 行く → 行かせる "make/let go" 泣く → 泣かせる "make cry" 笑う → 笑わせる "make laugh" Transitive base: 食べる → 食べさせる "make/let eat" 読む → 読ませる "make/let read" 書く → 書かせる "make/let write" Both types form causatives Pattern stays same

children.heading: Different from させていただく
children.content: Causative: させる "make/let do" Humble request: させていただく "humbly do / be allowed to do" 勉強させる "make (someone) study" 勉強させていただく "humbly study / be allowed to study" Different functions Different meanings Don't mix up

children.heading: Neutral formation
children.content: Causative form itself neutral: Casual: 食べさせた Polite: 食べさせました Formal: 食べさせました Formality from conjugation Not from causative itself Adjust ending as needed

children.heading: Long forms
children.content: Causative adds length: 食べる (3 mora) → 食べさせる (5 mora) 見る (2 mora) → 見させる (4 mora) Longer forms Can sound heavy Natural in context

children.heading: Drill examples
children.content: Convert to causative: 飲む → 飲ませる 書く → 書かせる 来る → 来させる する → させる 食べる → 食べさせる 見る → 見させる 行く → 行かせる 帰る → 帰らせる 寝る → 寝させる 起きる → 起きさせる Regular practice Builds automaticity Master patterns

children.heading: Pronunciation notes
children.content: Some require attention: 話す → 話させる (hanasaseru) Three さ sounds 待つ → 待たせる (mataseru) Not "machiseru" 死ぬ → 死なせる (shinaseru) な appears Learn correct readings Practice pronunciation

children.heading: Seeing causatives used
children.content: 親が子供に野菜を食べさせる "Parent makes child eat vegetables" 先生が生徒に本を読ませる "Teacher has students read book" 子供を公園で遊ばせる "Let child play in park" Natural usage Common patterns Real examples

children.heading: Causative as foundation
children.content: Once you know causative formation: Can add passive: させられる Can add てもらう: させてもらう Can add てください: させてください Foundation for advanced forms Master formation first Expand from there

sections.heading: Common Mistakes
sections.content: ❌ Using wrong group pattern ✗ 食べるせる ✓ Know verb groups ✓ 食べさせる ❌ Forgetting irregular forms ✗ 来るさせる ✓ Memorize exceptions ✓ 来させる ❌ Wrong conjugation of causative ✗ 食べさせます (should be 食べさせます is correct, but thinking it conjugates as う-verb) ✓ All causatives are る-verbs ✓ 食べさせます Formation is mechanical Follow patterns exactly Practice makes perfect

children.heading: Formation practice
children.content: Base → Causative: 歩く → 歩かせる "make/let walk" 立つ → 立たせる "make/let stand" 座る → 座らせる "make/let sit" 泣く → 泣かせる "make cry" 笑う → 笑わせる "make laugh" 休む → 休ませる "make/let rest" 働く → 働かせる "make/let work" 遊ぶ → 遊ばせる "make/let play" Daily verbs Common causatives Practice these Master formation Natural usage follows
